page.title: 08Leisure in N.E.Mynd Villages
page.content: Village halls are the focal point of social life.Functions held include Charity dances,Bring & Buy sales,Punch & Pate evenings and whist drives. A weekly playgroup and a Social Group for Elderly Persons is held in Leebot- wood's Village Hall, whilst Smethcott has a Bible Holiday Club for one week per year, which is well attended by children up to teenage. Most women belong to the Women's Institute and the old traditional pastimes are popular.Sewing,knitting, embroidery and tapestry work together with cooking,gardening and reading, compete strongly against the variety of evening classes offered in local towns.There is a keen Young Farmers' Club offering a full range of crafts and recreations.These include foreign exchange visits to Israel, Canada, France and Germany.
